questions.text: The inferior mesenteric artery is often occluded by atherosclerosis without symptoms; its normal area of distribution receives collateral blood flow from which other arteries?
questions.solution:
Explanation:

When the inferior mesenteric artery is occluded, its territory receives collateral circulation via anastomosis between the left colic artery (a branch of the inferior mesenteric artery) and the middle colic artery (a branch of the superior mesenteric artery).

  • The superior mesenteric artery supplies derivatives of the midgut, which extends from the mid-descending duodenum to the distal third of the transverse colon (including jejunum, ileum, caecum, appendix, and ascending and transverse colons).
  • The inferior mesenteric artery supplies the derivatives of the hindgut that extend from the distal transverse colon to the proximal anal canal.
  • The middle colic and left colic arteries are the most distal branches of the SMA and IMA, respectively. The middle colic artery and left colic artery communicate to form the Marginal artery of Drummond.
  • In the event of a block in the inferior mesenteric artery, the blood reaches the left side of the colon via the Marginal artery of Drummond.

Abdominal aorta and its branches:

The abdominal aorta extends from T12 to L4 and has three branches: ventral, lateral and dorsal branches.

choices.text: Lymphatic vessels of the caecum drain into lymph nodes related to the superior mesenteric artery
The epicolic nodes lie very close to the marginal artery.
In rectal or sigmoid colon cancer, preterminal colic lymph nodes are excised.
The paracolic lymph nodes are found along the mesenteric borders of the colon.

questions.text: All are true about the lymphatic drainage of the large intestine except:
questions.solution:
Explanation:

The paracolic nodes lie very close to the marginal arterial anastomosis, while the epicolic nodes are found on the colonic wall.

Lymphatic drainage of the large intestine:

  • Lymph drainage from the large intestine follows the course of the arteries.
  • Lymphatic vessels of the caecum and the ascending and proximal transverse colon drain into lymph nodes related to the superior mesenteric artery. (Option A)
  • While those of the distal transverse colon, descending colon, sigmoid colon and rectum drain into nodes along the course of the inferior mesenteric artery.
  • Lymph nodes related to the colon form four groups: epicolic, paracolic, intermediate colic and preterminal colic.
  • Epicolic nodes are minute whitish nodules on the serosal surface of the colon.
  • Paracolic nodes lie along the medial borders of the ascending and descending colon and the mesenteric borders of the transverse and sigmoid colon. And lies close to the marginal artery anastomosis. (Option D)
  • Intermediate colic nodes lie along the named colic vessels (the ileocolic, right colic, middle colic, left colic, sigmoid and superior rectal arteries).
  • Preterminal colic nodes lie along the main trunks of the superior and inferior mesenteric arteries and drain into pre-aortic nodes.
  • Radical lymphadenectomy during resection of colorectal cancer requires the removal of the highest possible lymph nodes draining the region of the colon in which the tumour is located.
  • In cases of cancer of the rectum or sigmoid colon, this usually involves excision of the pre-terminal colic nodes along the inferior mesenteric artery with ligation of the artery at its root or just below the origin of the left colic artery. (Option C)

questions.text: The anastomotic artery running along the border of the large intestine is called the:
questions.solution:
Explanation:

The marginal artery of Drummond is the anastomotic artery that runs along the border of the large intestine.

Marginal artery of Drummond:

  • The marginal artery is a circumferential arterial channel located close to the colon. It extends from the ileocecal junction to the rectosigmoid junction.
  • It is an anastomotic channel formed by colic branches of the superior mesenteric artery and the inferior mesenteric artery.
  • The marginal artery of the colon can become massively dilated when there is chronic stenosis or occlusion of the superior or inferior mesenteric artery.
  • The latter may occur, for example, in association with an abdominal aortic aneurysm, when the descending colon remains viable because the marginal artery continues to receive an adequate blood supply from left branches of the middle colic artery, and the sigmoid colon gains its blood supply from the middle anorectal and inferior anorectal arteries.
  • When colonic ischaemia does occur, it is usually maximal in the region of the left colic flexure and proximal descending colon because this segment is farthest from the collateral arterial supplies.

Explanation of other options:

Arcade (Option A): Arcades are anastomotic loops between arteries that provide alternative pathways for blood flow. These arcades are more prominent in the small intestine than the large intestine.

Areteriae rectae (Option B): Arteriae rectae (straight arteries) are the small branches that run from the marginal artery to reach the colon.

Coronary artery (Option C): The coronary arteries supply blood to the heart, but the gastric veins are referred to as coronary veins because they crown the lesser curvature of the stomach.

questions.text: A surgeon, while performing an appendectomy, was unable to identify the base of the appendix due to massive adhesions in the peritoneal cavity. After identifying the caecum, which anatomical structure would help her locate the base of the appendix?
questions.solution:
Explanation for answer:

The structure marked C in the above diagram is the Taenia coli, which helps in identifying the base of the appendix. The teniae coli are three in number and are present on the cecum; they converge at the base of the appendix.


Gross distinguishing features of the large intestine:

  • Taeniae coli - The teniae coli are three bands of longitudinal muscle on the surface of the large intestine. The large intestine does not have a continuous layer of longitudinal muscle--instead, it has Teniae In the caecum, the three taeniae coli form a characteristic 'trefoil' pattern on the caecal wall and converge at the base of the appendix.
  • Haustra coli - The haustra of the colon represent sites where the mucosa and submucosa of the colonic wall are infolded; these folds partially span the lumen of the colon but never form a complete circumferential ring. The pattern of haustra and appearance of the colonic mucosa help the clinician appreciate the level reached during flexible endoscopic examinations of the colon.
  • Epiploic coli - Epiploic or omental appendages are fatty appendages that are unique to the large intestine.

questions.text: Visceral pain is often referred to as a site on the body wall that is innervated by the same spinal cord segment that innervates the visceral organ involved. The pain of appendicitis is often first felt around the umbilicus, indicating that the appendix receives its sympathetic from which spinal cord segment?
questions.solution:
Explanation:

The appendix receives sympathetic innervation from the T10 segment of the spinal cord, and the T10 dermatome corresponds to the area around the umbilicus. This is an example of referred pain.

  • Visceral afferent fibres within adjacent nerves are responsible for the initial symptoms of acute appendicitis (colicky pain) that are caused by distension and inflammation of the appendix.
  • Abdominal pain from appendicitis is poorly localised initially and referred to the umbilical region of the abdomen. Gradually, the pain is localised in the right iliac fossa due to the parietal peritoneum adjacent to the appendix becoming involved in the inflammatory process as somatic nociceptors are stimulated.

Referred pain:

Referred pain occurs when visceral pain is felt on the skin due to the convergence of visceral and somatic sensory nerves on the same point in the spinal cord.

The brain may project the dull pain from the viscera onto the skin, where the pain is typically sharper and more easily noticed.
